comment.author: 39337738@N07
comment._content:
londonderry or derry, is in County Derry, londonderry, not limerick !!
the craigavon bridge in the image still stands today

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks!   The 1905 sales catalog we used to provide the title information lists the county as "Limerick."  We'll need to be more skeptical of the publisher's information.

comment.author: 64848937@N00
comment._content: You might also be careful about the Derry versus Londonderry designations (although chances are you will offend either way)!  The Royal Irish Academy, a cross-border institution, and the oldest research body in Ireland decided after much discussion to call the city, Derry and the county, Londonderry.  Politicians and locals all split in different ways.  Originally designated Doire na Calgach in the 6-7th centuries the city over time became Doire and further Anglicized to Derry.  Doire being Irish for oakwood.  With the plantation of the area by merchants from London in the 16th and 17th Centuries the name became Londonderry and so the battles began as to what to call the place.  The local radio station in an effort to reduce tensions calls this provincial town, Stroke City.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you doctorbob, for the additional information.  We may just leave it as is for now, and see how others respond.

comment.author: 7945368@N05
comment._content: I seem to recall reading on a tourist information poster in Guild Hall Square, it says the name of the city became "Londonderry" after "The London Company" built the city walls.

comment.author: 28482406@N00
comment._content: The name was changed on the 29th June 1613

comment.author: 29492435@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/robertbohan] Gerry Anderson a presenter on the Local BBC Radio Station refers, tongue in cheek, to Derry/Londonderry as Stroke City. The BBC themselves avoided the issue when naming the radio station by calling it BBC Radio Foyle after the river that runs through the city.
